roleset.name: stop, prevent

example.name: simple transitive
example.text: She-1 wanted *trace*-1 to prevent the damage to self-esteem that her low-ability students would suffer from doing badly on the test.
example.arg: the damage to self-esteem that her low-ability students would suffer from doing badly on the test

example.name: secondary predicate
example.text: Lawyers-1 seek *trace-1* to prevent the client from *trace-2* committing a criminal act.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: We could prevent many of these fatalities with minimum roof-crush standards.

example.name: instrument as subject
example.text: Steel jackets of a type that-1 *trace*-1may have prevented collapse of the columns of a 1.5-mile stretch of the Nimitz Freeway had been installed on at least a small test section of the double - decker highway
example.arg: collapse of the columns of a 1.5-mile stretch of the Nimitz Freeway

roleset.note: Note that the instrument can appear in subject position as well ("Minumum roof-crush standards could prevent many of these fatalities.") This means there is a de facto intentionality or animacy criterion for agenthood.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'prevent' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'stop' and 'force' and 'keep_from'
